action.action-desc: Ms. Porter (for herself, Mr. Gallagher, Ms. Sewell, Mr. Ciscomani, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. LaMalfa, Mrs. Torres of California, Mr. Duarte, and Mrs. Kim of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit contributions and donations by foreign nationals in connection with State or local ballot initiatives or referenda and recall elections.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Foreign Interference in Ballot Measures Act.

section.header: Prohibition on contributions and donations by foreign nationals in connection with ballot initiatives and referenda and recall elections

subsection.text: Section 319(a)(1)(A) of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 (52 U.S.C. 30121(a)(1)(A)) is amended by striking election; and inserting the following: election, including a State or local ballot initiative or referendum or recall election;.
The amendment made by this Act shall apply with respect to elections held in 2024 or any succeeding year.
